Sentencas: A microscale model of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) involving the mass transfer together with the electrochemical reaction, the transportation of electrons and ions through the respective spherical shaped electron conducting and ion conducting particles inside the electrodes was mathematically developed.
Titulo: Microscale Modeling of an Anode-Supported Planar Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Couples of useful parameters were introduced in order to represent the characteristics of the cell.
Titulo: Microscale Modeling of an Anode-Supported Planar Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The predicted cell performance was showed according to various operating and design conditions.
Titulo: Microscale Modeling of an Anode-Supported Planar Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The effects of microscale electrode geometry on the cell performance were also taken into account.
Titulo: Microscale Modeling of an Anode-Supported Planar Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Parametric study according to the volumetric fraction of ionic and electronic conducting particles was conducted in order to examine the effects of operating conditions on the cell overpotentials.
Titulo: Microscale Modeling of an Anode-Supported Planar Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The study results substantiate the fact that SOFC overpotential could be effectively decreased by increasing the operating temperature as well as operating pressure.
Titulo: Microscale Modeling of an Anode-Supported Planar Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: This present study reveals the working mechanisms of SOFC at the microscale level, while demonstrating the use of microscale relations to enhance the SOFC performance.
Titulo: Microscale Modeling of an Anode-Supported Planar Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The accuracy of the presented model was validated by comparing with already existing experimental results from the available literatures.
Titulo: Microscale Modeling of an Anode-Supported Planar Solid Oxide Fuel Cell
